metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29265 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.11.7.usbip_sockfd_store in drivers/usb/usbip/stub_dev.c allows attackers tocause a denial of service (GPF) because the stub-up sequence has raceconditions during an update of the local and shared status, akaCID-9380afd6df70.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29265` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-143.147~16.04.3
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-143.147~16.04.3
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-143.147~16.04.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1126.140
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1102.109~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1099.112~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1071.79~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-143.147~16.04.3').
linux-kvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1126.140').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1102.109~16.04.1').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1099.112~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1071.79~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
